description:
Nature made Ash Lynx beautiful; nurture made him a cold ruthless killer. A runaway brought up as the adopted heir and sex toy of "Papa" Dino Golzine, Ash, now at the rebellious age of seventeen, forsakes the kingdom held out by the devil who raised him. But the hideous secret that drove Ash's older brother mad in Vietnam has suddenly fallen into Papa's insatiably ambitious hands—and it's exactly the wrong time for Eiji Okamura, a pure-hearted young photographer from Japan, to make Ash Lynx's acquaintance...

(Source: Viz Media)

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Criminal Organization
tags.description: Prominently features a group of people who commit crimes for illicit or violent purposes.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

tags.name: Classic Literature
tags.description: Discusses or adapts a work of classic world literature.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

node.description: [Official Website](https://flowers.shogakukan.co.jp/migration/y_diary/) A Japanese manga artist and a graduate of Musashino Art University. She made her professional debut in 1977 with the short story "Chotto Fushigi na Geshukunin" ("A Slightly Strange Neighbor"), published in Bessatsu Shoujo Comic magazine. Yoshida is best known for the crime thriller series Banana Fish, which received an anime adaptation produced by MAPPA in 2018. She won the Shogakukan Manga Award for Kisshou Tennyo and Kawa yori mo Nagaku Yuruyaka ni in 1984, Yasha in 2002, and Umimachi Diary in 2016. Yoshida also received an Excellence Award for manga at the Japan Media Arts Festival for Umimachi Diary in 2007. In 2013, she won the Manga Taishou award for Umimachi Diary. (Source: Wikipedia)

Hiroko Utsumi is a Japanese director and animator.

Utsumi is best known for her work with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/), particularly as the original director of [Free!](https://anilist.co/anime/18507/), and for her later work at [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/), where she directed [Banana Fish](https://anilist.co/anime/100388/). She is a graduate of the Osaka Municipal College of Design.

(Source: Wikipedia)

An art director who worked for Kobayashi Productions, but left together with [Hiromasa Ogura](https://anilist.co/staff/105312/) and Hiroshi Oono to establish Studio Fuga in March 3, 1983. He stayed until 1997, when he left to establish Moonflower, where he also acts as representative director.

node.description:
[Website](https://survivesaidtheprophet.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SSTPofficial) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/survivesaidtheprophet) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/survivesaidtheprophet) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SSTPOFFICIAL)

__Biography__
Survive Said The Prophet commonly known as “SABAPURO” is formed in Tokyo, Japan in 2011. A native English speaker / bilingual vocalist, Yosh’s overwhelming singing ability and charisma at the head, it’s a miracle international rock band that consists of five talented, musicianship, and original characters. Their outstanding musicality is based on the wide background not limited to rock but also pop, electro, hip hop and R&B to place their field of activities in various fields using its diversity as a weapon that doesn’t fit in the frame of an existing scene and continues to evolve every day.

__Current Members__
- [Yoshiya Morita](https://anilist.co/staff/219035/Yosh) (Yosh) - vocal
- Tatsuya Kato - guitar
- [Ivan Kwong](https://anilist.co/staff/288633) - guitar
- Show Okada - drums

__Former Members__
- Takuya Suzuki - guitar (resigned in 2015)
- Kei Tatsuno - drums
- Yuki Hanazawa - support bassist, dirty vocal
- Yudai Kato - bass, scream (resigned in 2021)

(Sources: Survive Said the Prophet official website and Wikipedia)

name.native: ブルー・エンカウント

node.description:
__[Website](https://blueencount.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BLUEN_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/blueencount_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/blueencountSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2004
__Genres:__ Rock (Mixture Rock, Indie Rock), Emo

__Introduction:__
Blue Encount (stylized as BLUE ENCOUNT), alternatively known under the abbreviation BLUEN is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Ki/oon Records (2014-), who have previously been under record label 美音 (Mio) (2013-2014)

__Biography:__
In 2003, Shunichi, Yuuya and Yoshihide met at a vocational school in the Kumamoto Prefecture, where they would later in 2004 form the band Blue Encount. The band's name derives from a jinx that says bands with a color in their name sells, as well as a movie that the vocalist Shunichi saw at a rental shop titled "Blue Encounter".

In 2006, at the TEENS' MUSIC FESTIVAL, which was sponsored by the Yamaha Music Promotion Association and Nippon Broadcasting, they participated in the Kyuushuu qualifying round as the Kumamoto Prefecture representative, but they did not advance to the national competition. The bassist at the time withdrew from the band to enter university, and after graduating from a certain college of technology Yuuya and Yoshihide came to Tokyo and began studying at the Tokyo School of Music College in Shibuya. Yuuta, a senior at a vocational school participated as a support member at the time.

In 2008, the band participated in Yamaha's "The 2nd Music Revolution JAPAN FINAL" as a representative of Tokyo FINAL. This is also when Yuuta officially decided to join the band.

In 2010, the band released their first mini album titled "The Beginning of the Beginning". The response on the album were not as expected, and the members of the band instead called it "The Dark Ages". After that, they went on a split tour with the bands ircle and SUPER BEAVER, and said that occasional advice from both of the bands was a large help to escape the "dark age" as they called it.

On April 11, 2012, the 2nd mini album "HALO EFFECT" was released. The title song "HALO" has helped increase the number of YouTube views, and the number of live shows started piling in for them as a band.

On November, 2013, they released a split album titled "BONEDS" with the bands [MY FIRST STORY](https://anilist.co/staff/127675/My-First-Story), AIR SWELL and [SWANKY DANK](https://anilist.co/staff/132868/SWANKY-DANK).

On September 10, 2014, they made a major debut under Ki/oon Music with their EP titled "TIMELESS ROOKIE", this is also when they left their previous record label titled 美音 (Mio).

On October 9, 2016, the band made had their first one-man live show held at the Nippon Budokan. The tickets sold out the same day and had 11.000 people pending for the show. In addition, during this live performance, they directy spoke with the producer of the Japanese television drama "THE LaST COP/ラストコップ", and was then scheduled to perform the theme song for the show. The drama first broadcasted on the October 29, which is when they made their first appearance in a serial TV drama as a unit.

__Members:__
- [Shunichi Tanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/148599/Shunichi-Tanabe) (田邊駿一) - vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition (2004-)
- Yuuya Eguchi (江口雄也) - guitarist (2004-)
- Yuuta Tsujimura (辻村勇太) - bassist (2006-2008, as a support member) (2008-, as an official member)
- Yoshihide Takamura (高村佳秀) - drummer (2004-)

(Source: [Wikipedia (BLUE ENCOUNT)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLUE_ENCOUNT), edited)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/@tanusuke45) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kōnosuke_Uda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宇田鋼之介)

He graduated from the Animation Department of Tokyo Design Academy and worked as a freelancer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). He currently works mainly for [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
